data.text:
Are you a fan of crime fiction novels and wondering how to read Michael Connelly books in order? If so, you are in the right place.

Crime fiction novels are among the most famous literary genres, offering fans many authors to enjoy. One of the prominent names is Michael Connelly, known for his ability to create suspense, anticipation, and thrill with his books.

Starting his career as a crime reporter, it’s no surprise that Connelly has become a successful crime novelist. He has penned 26 bestselling novels. His debut novel, The Black Echo, was published in 1992 and received critical acclaim. Connelly quickly followed it up with three more books featuring LAPD Detective Harry Bosch.

Throughout his career, Connelly has written numerous novels, including The Lincoln Lawyer and Blood Work. Both the stories were later adapted into successful films. As a successful author, he has sold over 42 million copies worldwide. Not only that, his books were also translated into 45 different languages. That being said, let us now delve into Michael Connelly’s books.

About Michael Connelly

Before we tell you how to read Michael Connelly books in order, it is essential first to know about the writer.

Michael Connelly is labeled as the #1 New York Times bestselling author. But you will be surprised that his writing career is differently planned. His initial plan was to work in construction, but he changed his mind after watching the 1973 adoption of Raymond Chandler’s book “The Long Goodbye” during college. The film inspired him so much that he started writing crime fiction.

After graduating in journalism, he became a successful journalist in Florida. Later, he moved to Los Angeles to become a writer. He started writing novels while still working as a journalist. He left his job only after his third book became a success.

Since then, Connelly has authored 38 novels and one non-fiction book. His works have sold over 80 million copies worldwide, making him one of the most successful writers. He has also won numerous awards for his writing, including the Anthony Award, the Macavity Award, and the Edgar Award. Connelly’s books are celebrated globally and translated into more than 45 languages.

How To Read Michael Connelly Books In Order?

Reading all Michael Connelly books in order might seem daunting, but it is possible. It is recommended you start with the Harry Bosch series, but if you would like, you can also start with a Mickey Haller or Renée Ballard book.

However, if you decide to go with the latter, you might need help understanding the story. This is because you are not familiar with the character Harry Bosch. This is why it is better to start from the beginning with the Harry Bosch series. That way, you will enjoy the story and enhance your reading experience.

Also, Harry Bosch isn’t just a character; he’s a rich, immersive world worth exploring. That’s why it’s highly recommended that Michael Connelly’s books be put in order.

Book To Screen Adaptations

The first time Michael Connelly’s work was adapted for the screen was in 2002 with the movie “Blood Work.” Clint Eastwood played the main character, Terry McCaleb, and directed the film.

Unfortunately, it didn’t do well at the box office or with critics, marking Eastwood’s last action role.

After “Blood Work,” the subsequent adaptation came with “The Lincoln Lawyer,” based on Connelly’s book. Matthew McConaughey starred as Mick Haller in the movie, but it didn’t turn into a series of films.

However, in 2022, a TV show based on “The Lincoln Lawyer” was released, starring Manuel Garcia-Rulfo as Mickey Haller.

Streaming platforms are the best fit for Connelly’s stories. Amazon Studios has already produced “Bosch,” a series that ran for seven seasons with Titus Welliver in the lead role. It even led to a spin-off called “Bosch: Legacy,” which is now gearing up for its second season.

Additionally, there are plans for two more spin-offs, one focusing on Renée Ballard and the other on Jerry Edgar.

Where To Read Michael Connelly Books?

You can find Michael Connelly’s books in various places. Most libraries carry his novels so that you can check your local library’s catalog. If you prefer reading digitally, you can explore ebook platforms like Kindle, Nook, or Apple Books, where you can purchase or borrow digital copies.

Major online retailers such as Amazon and Barnes & Noble also offer physical copies and e-books for sale. Additionally, many bookstores stock Connelly’s books, so you can visit your nearest bookstore and browse their selection.

Final Words

Exploring Michael Connelly’s exciting world of crime and justice with his famous character Harry Bosch is a journey worth taking. By reading Michael Connelly books in order, you can better understand the stories. So, pick up the first book, “The Black Echo,” and get ready for a thrilling trip through the streets of Los Angeles with Harry Bosch as your guide.
